howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Get connected in 3 simple steps — no physical SIM card needed.
howItWorks.step1Desc: Browse 200+ destinations. Pick the country or region you're visiting and select a data plan that fits your trip — from 1 GB to 20 GB, short trips or long stays.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Pay securely online. Your eSIM is delivered instantly to your email with a QR code and clear installation instructions. No shipping, no waiting.
howItWorks.step3Desc: Scan the QR code with your phone's camera. Follow the on-screen prompts to add the eSIM. Turn on Data Roaming for your eSIM line, and you're online!
howItWorks.iphoneStep1: Go to Settings → Cellular → Add Cellular Plan
howItWorks.iphoneStep2: Scan the QR code from your email
howItWorks.iphoneStep4: Set it as your Cellular Data line
howItWorks.iphoneStep5: Turn on Data Roaming for the eSIM line
howItWorks.androidStep1: Go to Settings → Network & Internet → SIMs → Add eSIM
howItWorks.androidStep2: Choose "Scan QR code" and scan the code from your email
howItWorks.androidStep3: Follow the prompts to install the profile
howItWorks.androidStep4: Set the eSIM as your mobile data line
howItWorks.tip1: Install your eSIM before you travel — it won't activate until you arrive and connect to a local network.
howItWorks.tip2: Keep your physical SIM active for calls and SMS. Use the eSIM only for data.
howItWorks.tip3: Turn off Data Roaming on your physical SIM to avoid surprise charges.
howItWorks.tip4: Make sure your device is unlocked and connected to Wi-Fi during installation.
howItWorks.tip5: iPhones can store up to 10 eSIM profiles; Android devices can store 5–7.
howItWorks.activationQR: QR Code Scan — The easiest method. Simply scan the QR code we send you.
howItWorks.activationManual: Manual Entry — Enter the SM-DP+ address and Activation Code in your device settings.
howItWorks.activationLink: Direct Link (iPhone) — Tap the install link from your email on an iPhone to start setup automatically.
howItWorks.trouble1Desc: Make sure Data Roaming is ON for the eSIM line. Restart your device. It can take a few minutes to connect the first time.
howItWorks.trouble2Desc: Ensure your device is unlocked and supports eSIM. Connect to a strong Wi-Fi network. Make sure the QR code hasn't been scanned on another device.
howItWorks.trouble3Desc: Restart your device. Try manually selecting a network: Settings → Cellular → Network Selection → turn off Automatic and choose a network.
howItWorks.trouble4Desc: Try re-scanning the original QR code. If the eSIM was already activated, you may need to purchase a new one.

devices.title: Compatible Devices
devices.subtitle: Make sure your device is unlocked and supports eSIM before purchasing. Locked or carrier-contracted devices cannot use eSIM.
devices.importantNote: Your device must be carrier-unlocked. Contact your carrier if unsure.
devices.iphoneList: iPhone 16 / 16 Plus / 16 Pro / 16 Pro Max, iPhone 15 / 15 Plus / 15 Pro / 15 Pro Max, iPhone 14 / 14 Plus / 14 Pro / 14 Pro Max, iPhone 13 / 13 Mini / 13 Pro / 13 Pro Max, iPhone 12 / 12 Mini / 12 Pro / 12 Pro Max, iPhone 11 / 11 Pro / 11 Pro Max, iPhone XS / XS Max / XR, iPhone SE (2nd gen and later)
devices.ipadList: iPad Pro (3rd gen and later), iPad Air (3rd gen and later), iPad Mini (5th gen and later), iPad (7th gen and later)
devices.samsungList: Galaxy S25 / S24 / S23 / S22 / S21 / S20 series, Galaxy Z Fold / Z Flip series (all models), Galaxy Note 20 / Note 20 Ultra, Galaxy A54 5G / A35 5G
devices.otherList: Huawei P40 / P50 / Mate 40 series, Xiaomi 13 / 14 series, OPPO Find X5 / X3 Pro, Motorola Razr series, Sony Xperia 1 IV / 10 IV
devices.checkStep1: iPhone: Go to Settings → General → About. If you see an "Available SIM" or "eSIM" field, your device supports eSIM.
devices.checkStep2: Android: Go to Settings → Network & Internet → SIMs. If you see "Add eSIM" or "Download SIM", your device supports eSIM.
devices.checkStep3: You can also dial *#06# — if an EID number appears, your device has eSIM capability.
devices.dualSimDesc: You can use your physical SIM for calls and SMS while using the eSIM for data. Go to Settings → Cellular and assign each SIM its role.

help.title: Help Center
help.subtitle: Everything you need to know about using your eSIM. Can't find what you're looking for? Contact our support team.

faq.answerWhatIsEsim: An eSIM (embedded SIM) is a digital SIM built into your phone. It lets you activate a cellular data plan without needing a physical SIM card. Simply scan a QR code or tap a link to install — it's that easy.
faq.howToInstall: How do I install my eSIM?
faq.answerHowToInstall: After purchase, you'll receive an email with a QR code. On iPhone: go to Settings → Cellular → Add Cellular Plan → scan the QR code. On Android: go to Settings → Network & Internet → SIMs → Add eSIM → scan the QR code. Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi during installation.
faq.answerWhenToActivate: Your plan activates when you connect to a mobile network at your destination. The validity period starts counting from first use, not from purchase. eSIMs are valid for 180 days before activation, so you can buy in advance.
faq.canUseDualSim: Can I use my physical SIM and eSIM together?
faq.answerCanUseDualSim: Yes! On dual-SIM devices, you can keep your physical SIM for calls and SMS while using the eSIM for mobile data. Go to Settings → Cellular and assign each SIM its role.
faq.dataRoaming: Do I need to turn on Data Roaming?
faq.answerDataRoaming: Yes — turn on Data Roaming for your eSIM line. This is required for the eSIM to connect to local networks. Make sure to turn OFF roaming on your physical SIM to avoid surprise charges from your home carrier.
faq.hotspot: Can I use my eSIM as a hotspot?
faq.answerHotspot: Most plans support personal hotspot / tethering. Check the plan details before purchase. On iOS, APNs are preconfigured automatically.
faq.multipleEsim: Can I store multiple eSIMs on one phone?
faq.answerMultipleEsim: Yes. iPhones can store up to 10 eSIM profiles, and Android devices can store 5–7. Only one eSIM can be active for data at a time. Label your eSIMs to keep them organized.
faq.topUp: Can I top up my eSIM with more data?
faq.answerTopUp: Some plans support top-ups. If available, you can purchase additional data for your existing eSIM — no need to install a new one. Check the plan details for top-up availability.
faq.reinstall: Can I reinstall a deleted eSIM?
faq.answerReinstall: Yes — if you accidentally delete your eSIM, you can reinstall it by scanning the original QR code, as long as the plan is still valid and has remaining data. However, an eSIM cannot be transferred to a different device once activated.
faq.answerRefundPolicy: Unused and uninstalled eSIMs can be refunded within 14 days of purchase. Once an eSIM is installed or activated, it cannot be refunded. See our Refund Policy page for complete details.
faq.answerCoverage: We partner with tier-1 local operators in each country for the best coverage. Coverage is excellent in urban areas. Rural coverage may vary by country. Check each plan's details for specific network information, including 4G/5G availability.
faq.compatibleDevices: Is my phone compatible with eSIM?
faq.answerCompatibleDevices: Most modern smartphones support eSIM — including iPhone XS and later, Samsung Galaxy S20+, Google Pixel 3+, and many more. Your device must be carrier-unlocked. Visit our Compatible Devices page for the full list.
faq.vpn: Should I use a VPN with my eSIM?
faq.answerVpn: While not required, a VPN can enhance your privacy when using public networks abroad. Make sure to turn off any VPN during eSIM installation, as it can interfere with the download process.
faq.noSignal: What if I have no signal after arriving?
faq.answerNoSignal: Restart your device to refresh the network connection. Make sure Data Roaming is ON for the eSIM line. If still no signal, try selecting a network manually: Settings → Cellular → Network Selection. It can take a few minutes to connect the first time.

about.title: About Sim2Me
about.mission: We make staying connected abroad simple and affordable. No more hunting for local SIMs or paying high roaming fees.
about.story: Sim2Me was built by travelers, for travelers. We know how frustrating it is to land in a new country and scramble for a local SIM card. That's why we created the easiest way to get mobile data anywhere in the world — instantly, affordably, and without leaving your seat.
about.why1Desc: No shipping, no waiting. Your eSIM arrives in your inbox within seconds of purchase.
about.why2Desc: Single-country and regional plans covering every continent. One eSIM for multi-country trips.
about.why3Desc: We negotiate directly with tier-1 operators worldwide to bring you competitive rates — up to 65% cheaper than traditional roaming.
about.why4Desc: Scan a QR code, follow three simple steps, and you're connected. No technical knowledge required.
about.why5Desc: Powered by GSMA-certified eSIM technology with data centers in the EU. Your data and privacy are protected.
about.why6Desc: Our support team is here to help before, during, and after your trip. Reach out anytime.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Have a question, need help with your eSIM, or just want to say hello? We'd love to hear from you.
contact.name: Full Name
contact.subject: Subject
contact.supportDesc: For help with installation, activation, connectivity issues, or refund requests.
contact.responseTime: We typically respond within a few hours.
contact.beforeTip1: Check our Help Center — your question may already be answered.
contact.beforeTip2: Have your order number or eSIM details ready for faster support.
contact.beforeTip3: Include screenshots if you're experiencing a technical issue.
